task_summary: Sequential visual localization and approach for a robot to reach and align with a towel.

task_long_description.overview: The episode demonstrates a bimanual robotic arm tasked with reaching a visible pink towel placed on a work surface. The robot begins from a standoff position and methodically perceives, localizes, and moves above the towel. Through careful vertical and lateral alignment, the system prepares for subsequent towel manipulation. The entire approach prioritizes perception-driven correction and positional safety, relying on vision-based reacquisition and precise movement.
preconditions: Workspace is clear; towel is present and within reachable zone.
Robot is powered and gripper is free.
Perception system operational; towel is detectable in the scene.
stepwise_plan: Check if towel is visible using vision.
If not visible, scan the workspace to reacquire the towel’s location.
Detect and localize the towel object.
Move the end-effector above the towel at a predefined offset.
Approach and align to the towel within a tight positional tolerance.
Wait briefly to confirm stable posture before further actions.
success_criteria: End-effector positioned above and aligned to the towel within tolerance.
Towel is reliably detected and located.
Robot avoids collision with workspace and other objects.
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect towel: perform scan up to 3 times.
Approach misalignment: retry approach and alignment phase.
Timeout or mechanical error: abort and report to operator.
task_long_description.termination: Tree completes after successful align and wait. Control hands off for next action.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the towel is currently visible to the robot’s perception system.
Performs grid-pattern scanning of the workspace to reacquire the towel if not visible.
Localizes and confirms the position of the towel.
Moves the end-effector directly above the towel at a 5cm vertical offset.
Fine approach and alignment to the towel, with tight (5mm) positional tolerance.
Brief pause to confirm stable posture.

failure_modes: Timeout during move or scan operation.
recovery_strategy: Scan again if towel not visible.
Retry approach and alignment if positional error detected.
Abort or operator intervention if persistent failure.
assumptions: No grasping or manipulation is shown in these frames; only approach is performed.
Contact-sheet frames do not show grasp; only reaching and positioning.
Instruction does not specify force, grasp, or manipulation, so those are omitted.

expected_success_criteria: End-effector is positioned above the towel with stable alignment.
Towel is detected with high confidence.
